Articles.Content:
So, after eight hours hours of nonstop clicking, swearing, and facepalms, I managed to put this bad boy into LKO. It took around a dozen launches to construct, and is part of my goal to do the impossible: Build an kilometer long space station.

More pictures to come.

O.o that is huge, and it looks like it could store a hundred or more Kerbals in it...

Very good job
Okay, if you are going to create a kilometer long station, keep the part count low.
That's amazing! How long are each of the Hitchhiker containers? I've always assumed they were 3m tall.
So, its 188 parts, and is 1/10th of a kilometer. But considering the scales and such, IRL, it might as well be a kilometerlong station.
Keep it up, and soon this thing will have its own gravitation And heat radiated by your compter will be detectable from the orbit
Have you had much lag?
Not much, but I'm going to add. extension. But yet agian, my computer has one of the best graphics card aviable on the market.
Other than reaching a certain length, does it serve a special purpose? Is it a hotel or something?
It serves as a refueling depot, ISV, and a ark.

one kilometer manned observbatory, awsome!

I have a 50 m space station and it lags!

one kilometer manned observbatory, awsome!

I have a 50 m space station and it lags!

Its around 200 meters. Not a kilometer. But I am planning another station, one that will destroy any computer except the supercomputer from NASA that the KSP servers are run on.

Wow... what processor do you have that it doesn't lag? My experience is that lag is based less on the GPU and more on the CPU speed. I can turn graphics all the way up and it still lags at the same part counts as when I have graphics turned all the way down.
I have a feeling KSP is going to die before you reach one kilometer.
I only wish I could build ships of that size without my computer bursting into flames... Ah well, that's the price I pay for running KSP on a laptop...

I have a feeling KSP is going to die before you reach one kilometer.

50% of the time this bad-boy is loaded, the textures break.
Jeez that's huge. My computer would probably catch fire.
Don't let Jeb pilot it, otherwise, goodbye ksc,
Currently working on extension. Launched to orbit. Extended the extension. Decoupled communication array to make way for docking port. Tommorrow, I will dock two of these.
Eventually, unfortunately you will reach the end of Unity's physics handling capability and no matter how good your computer is, it will still lag. Even still, cool space station.

I'm currently writing a story where Kerbin is attacked by the "International Space Fleet" from a star 11 LY away from a spieces of aliens who now reside on the third and fourth planets while living on the moons of the next two. The KMO is coverted to a massive laser cannon, and manages to destroy a human ISV, but is ultimately destroyed by a concentrated assault from the human spaceplanes.

50% of the time this bad-boy is loaded, the textures break.

Well that seems ominous.

*Waits for KSP to die and cause your PC to ignite*
No matter how good is your PC, after 600 parts it will lag anyway

Its around 200 meters. Not a kilometer. But I am planning another station, one that will destroy any computer except the supercomputer from NASA that the KSP servers are run on.

Just saying, a modern phone of today has more computing power, than the computer that sent Neil and Buzz on the moon.

OT: Damn, 1 kilometer. 10 metres, and my computer is at 5 FPS. Good luck!

Just saying, a modern phone of today has more computing power, than the computer that sent Neil and Buzz on the moon.

Thats because that the computer that took them to the moon was designed to be a calculator, and a calculator only.
